subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Cordoba: When Islam Ruled Europe
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cordoba: When Islam Ruled Europe.

hook.text: Muslims ruled Spain for 700 years. Cordoba had streetlights when London had mud. It was Europe's most advanced city.

buildup.text: Al-Andalus (Muslim Spain) lasted from 711 to 1492. At its peak, Cordoba had libraries with 400,000 books.

discovery.text: Jews, Christians, and Muslims shared 'convivencia.' Scholars translated texts that later fueled the Renaissance.

twist.text: The Reconquista expelled Muslims and Jews from Spain in 1492. Ferdinand and Isabella chose purity over brilliance.

climax.text: Cordoba shows what happens when faiths cooperate â€” and what's lost when tolerance ends. Coexistence was productive.

punchline.text: Muslim Cordoba was Europe's brightest city. Intolerance ended it.

quiz.question: What was 'convivencia' in Muslim Spain?
options: Coexistence of Jews, Christians, and Muslims
